riddle: I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What has keys but can’t open locks?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for long. What am I?
What has many teeth but can’t bite?
I’m always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What can travel around the world while staying in the same spot?
What has a neck but no head?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
What has an eye but cannot see?
I’m found in the sky but never in the sea. What am I?
What can run but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
What goes up but never comes down?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has four wheels and flies?
I have no hands but can knock on your door. What am I?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
I’m always running but never move. What am I?
I’m not alive, but I can grow. I don’t have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
What belongs to you but is used more by others?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What comes down but never goes up?
What has hands but can’t clap?
I fly without wings. I cry without eyes. What am I?
What has cities, but no houses; forests, but no trees; and rivers, but no water?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What has a thumb and four fingers but isn’t alive?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
The more you have of me, the less you see. What am I?
What has a ring but no finger?
I shrink every time I take a bath. What am I?
What has roots but never grows?
I am hard as rock, but melt in water. What am I?
What flies when it’s born, lies when it’s alive, and runs when it’s dead?
The more you pull me, the shorter I become. What am I?
What has a tail but no body?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
What breaks but never falls?
What falls but never breaks?
What has a heart that doesn’t beat?
I’m a kind of coat that can only be put on when wet. What am I?
I can be cracked, played, or made. What am I?
What can pierce through armor but is as soft as silk?
What lives in winter but dies in summer?
What has ears but cannot hear?
What is lighter than a feather but no one can hold for very long?
What comes down but never touches the ground?
What starts off dry and ends up wet?
What has branches but no fruit?
What has no doors but can still be entered?
